message.content:
We need to look for all the “Depreciation” entries in the provided transactions. In this case there are two lines:
 • The first depreciation row has an amount of 45,750.46 (recorded on 2024‑01‑01).
 • The second depreciation row has an amount of 45,748.42 (recorded on 2024‑02‑01).

Because the cash flow statement typically shows depreciation as a single add‐back item (i.e. the total non‑cash depreciation expense), we sum these two amounts:

  45,750.46 + 45,748.42 = 91,498.88

Thus, the final depreciation item to be reported in the cash flow statement is 91,498.88.

Below is the answer in the requested format.

--------------------------------------------------

{"solution": {"Depreciation": "91498.88"}}
